channel.title: Barney Calhoun?
channel.description:
Forgive me for this... but...
I've just read in the wiki that Barney's only appearance will be in the first chapter, Inbound, when you see him pounding on the door with his torch...
Now... I hate to say this, but that makes no sense.
Now, I suppose it's more than possible that they could simply know each other from before the events of the first game, but the way Barney talks when you meet him in HL2, it sounds as though Gordon and Barney did work together during the events of the resonance cascade crisis.
My suggestion therefore, is to have some small part of the game where you have to work together with Barney, for continuity's sake.
(although I've got sneaky suspicions that you've allready done so and simply aren't going to say so.)
Anyways, besides that, I've been lurking around, following this mod for over a year now. I am truelly amazed by what I see, and I am thoroughly looking forward to playing this when it is released despite what I've mentioned above.
I know you guys/girls are working really hard on this, and I am nothing, if not an admirer of hard work, knowing full well I'd never be able to do something like this myself.
Keep up the good work, and don't let people badger you about release dates!

item.dc:creator: John_Lemon
item.description:
You’re overthinking things as if what happens in the Half-Life games is all that ever happened to these characters. Alyx mentions in Ep 1 Barney and Gordon racing in air vents, but the two of you never do that in the game. Ergo, that event, and by extension of logic, the beer promise, happened sometime before the events of the game when the two goofballs were palling around at the office.

item.title: Barney Calhoun?
item.dc:creator: Yobym
item.description:
The main mess up point is where when playing blue shift you are indeed playing the role of Barney Calhoun, and you see freeman pass you on the tram when you cant open the door. In HL2 barney mentions the promise to you. In blue shift you never interact with freeman at all in the blue shift story (besides looking at him). But wait, in the intro to HL1 barney never looks at you! So, we can just look at all the small things and waist time arguing and analyzing it or we can just accept that it is just a small fun reference to HL1 time period. Don’t get me wrong, it is fun and interesting to talk about and it is a bit funny. But for the people that cant sleep thinking about this mysterious event just calm down and take a deep breath, and just keep it at a reference.

Robin, where did your life go so wrong. You made me blame the Gman on this mess…
